result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron Lewis McClyde

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Aaron Lewis McClyde in court.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Aaron Lewis McClyde.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Calendar Call. Defendant appears. Court vacates the stayed warrant.
Case adjourned for final pretrial and for jury trial in Branch 1.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 13, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Aaron Lewis McClyde not in court.  Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared by video for Aaron Lewis McClyde.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for pre-trial conference.  No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date. Case adjourned to Br. 1.
Calendar call scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SW.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Aaron Lewis McClyde in court.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 1 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 10/3/2022 @ 1:00pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 10/3/2022 @ 1pm.
